amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for activities to combat terrorism by $400 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in House Report 107-218 to create a new Title related to activities to combat terrorism; to provide $400 million in new funding for intelligence and anti-terrorism and counter-terrorism intitiatives through a reduction in funding for National Missile Defense programs and consulting services; to require an assessment of Defense Department ability to respond to terrorist attacks, a report on protection from airborne threats, the establishment of combating terrorism as a national security mission, and other policy matters related to combating terrorism.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Stump amendment (A007) Agreed to by voice vote.
